name: Estuary Delta
role_in_state: primary coastal intake and small-ship outfitting
economy_niches: kelp and seaweed processing (fertilizer, fiber additives)
culture_adjustments: local Coastal Tongues dialect with riverine vocabulary
net- and reed-working rites more central than open-sea festivals
apprenticeship favors shallow-water skippers over oceangoing crews
ancestor rituals syncretized with river/estuary spirits
constraints: limited deepwater berths; small-craft traffic only
seasonal tidal closures restrict trade windows
ritual reagents costly â€” augury limited in scale
notes: guild councils control charters and boatyards
salt-flat and kelp harvests run on communal permits
